Essential business workers as well as law enforcement and health personnel are exempted.

description:
Venezuela announced on March 16th an extension of the lockdown (dubbed as social quarantine) to the entire country, comprising all remaining states, starting on March 17th at 5AM until further notice. Essential business workers as well as law enforcement and health personnel are exempted.
Update: On April 12th, Venezuela extended the "social quarantine" for 30 days. This applies to all 23 states and Caracas. All activities will remain suspended except for food, health, transport, and security services

description:
New policy: Venezuela's president Maduro announced on April 24th a phase-out measure, in which adults older than 65 years old will be able to leave their house on April 27th, from 8am to 12pm. Children will be able to leave their house to exercise and do physical activities from 2pm to 6pm on April 28th. 
Old Policy: Venezuela announced on March 16th an extension of the lockdown (dubbed as social quarantine) to the entire country, comprising all remaining states, starting on March 17th at 5AM until further notice. Essential business workers as well as law enforcement and health personnel are exempted.

description: Venezuela is beginning its 7+7 lockdown plan on June 6th, with alternating weeks of radical and flexible quarantine. 10 economic sectors have reopened.

Venezuela is beginning its 7+7 lockdown plan on June 6th, with alternating weeks of radical and flexible quarantine. 10 economic sectors have reopened. End of policy: On June 15, the 7+7 lockdown plan will continue with 14 more economic sector reopening.
Venezuela's 7+7 policy is still in effect across the country. On June 15th, 14 more economic sectors have been allowed to open up.

Venezuela's 7+7 policy is still in effect across the country. On June 15th, 14 more economic sectors have been allowed to open up. End of policy: On August 10, phase 2 has extended to 17 states, allowing all economic sectors to reopen. Caracas, La Guaira, Miranda, Sucre, Tachira, Bolivar, and Zulia are under phase 1.

Venezeula's 7+7 plan is still in effect. 21 states of the country have been moved to Phase 2, which reopens all 24 economic sectors, including Mérida, Monagas, Trujillo, Carabobo, Yaracuy, Guárico, Portuguesa, Cojedes, Amazonas, Sucre, Nueva Esparta, Anzoátegui, Barinas, Aragua, Lara, Delta Amacuro, Falcón, as well as, Zulia, Bolívar, Táchira, Apure (excluding the bordering municipalities). Caracas, La Guaira and Miranda are still under Phase 1 – partial flexibility.

Venezeula's 7+7 plan is still in effect. 21 states of the country have been moved to Phase 2, which reopens all 24 economic sectors, including Mérida, Monagas, Trujillo, Carabobo, Yaracuy, Guárico, Portuguesa, Cojedes, Amazonas, Sucre, Nueva Esparta, Anzoátegui, Barinas, Aragua, Lara, Delta Amacuro, Falcón, as well as, Zulia, Bolívar, Táchira, Apure (excluding the bordering municipalities). Caracas, La Guaira and Miranda are still under Phase 1 – partial flexibility. End of policy: Venezuela is shifting to a 7+7 Plus plan that allows all states to participate in flexible quarantine weeks excet for border municipalities.

The Comisión Presidencial para la Prevención y Control del Coronavirus is created to "coordinate and advise everything related to the implementation of the measures that are necessary to adopt to stop and control the spread of the Coronavirus pandemic." It is in permanent session from March 13.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Ministry/Department of Justice,Ministry/Department of Education

description: Venezuela's council of state declares itself in state of emergency and permanent session on March 31st. The state council serves as a major advisor to the president and will from now supervise the situation of the pandemic.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Venezuela's council of state declares itself in permanent session to coordinate the Covid-19 response, starting the 31st of March 2020.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: Existing government entity given new powers

description: Venezuela's interim government, led by the president of Venezuela's National Assembly, Juan Guaidó, started a public awareness campaign on March 16th through multiple channels, to inform the population about the prevention mechanisms of contagion.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On June 1, Venezuela published handwashing and body hygiene techniques, recommending that the public "wash their hands frequently with soap and water using the proper technique, before leaving the house, when arriving at work or destination, before and after eating and using the toilet, before returning to the home and upon arrival, as well as after coughing, sneezing, and touching potentially contaminated surfaces. In the absence of soap and water, solutions or gels with 70% alcohol can be used."
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Venezuela required on March 14th that all passengers that had arrived from Europe during March to quarantine for at least two weeks

Venezuela announced on May 19th that it will be mandatory for its citizens abroad who enter the nation to comply with 14 days of quarantine in the border states, complying with the corresponding sanitary control measures, without being able to move to their states of residence.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Starting on June 1, Venezuela requires all persons entering the country to take a COVID-19 Rapid Diagnostic Test and quarantine for 14 days at los Puntos de Asistencia Social Integral (PASI).
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description:
Venezuela's president presented on May 30th the new model that will be applied from June 1 throughout the national territory, within the framework of the 1st phase of "dynamic flexibility" of quarantine; excepting the border municipalities that will maintain their respective curfews.
Venezuelan model is dubbed as 5 x 10: 5 days of flexibilization and 10 consecutive days of social quarantine. The phase out measure is only targeted at specific economic sectors.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: From June 1, Venezuela is requiring units that provide services, public and private: health, commercial, transport and work, as well as any other that authorizes their activity in the framework of the COVID19 pandemic to guarantee the sanitary and hygiene conditions established by the presidential commission of COVID19.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: From June 1, Venezuela is requring service providers, public and private: health, commercial, transport and work, as well as any other that their activity is authorized, to indicate in the elevators, if any, the number of people allowed to keep social distancing.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description:
The Venezuelan Institution for regulating the Banking sector (SUDEBAN) decreed the nationwide suspension of banking activities on March 15th, thus imposing a restriction on private and public banking business activities starting from March 16th. 
This measure has been partly lifted, as banking activities are resumed for certain hours of the day, as part of the nationwide "dynamic flexibility" phase-out model.
type_sub_cat: Financial service activities except insurance and pension funding
institution_status: This type of business  ("Financial service activities Financial service activities except insurance and pension funding") is closed/locked down

description: Venezuela's cardinal Baltazar Porras, announced on March 15th that all ecclesiastic activities would be suspended until further notice, but that places of worship remained open.
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Venezuela announced on March 13th the obligation to use face masks for all passengers using the subway system in the capital of Caracas. All passengers not complying with this measure will be banned from accessing the metro enforced by the National Bolivarian Police (NBP), the Service of Communal Police and the National Bolivarian Guard (GNB) starting on March 14th.
Starting on March 22nd, Venezuela has made it mandatory to wear face masks in public areas for all individuals. Police have been deployed to ensure people are sticking to quarantine measures.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere

description: The Venezuelan Governments ordered on April 16th to wear masks outside in any public space in addition to the previous order to wear them while using public transportation
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere

description: From June 1, Venezuela is mandating a minimum distance of 1.5 meters between people on streets, public transport when possible, at workplaces, and in meetings of 10 people.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
